elements.title: Sara Gadalla Gubara (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite her physical disability, Sara Gadalla Gubara (pictured) came third in a 50 km (31 mi) mixed-sex national swimming event in 1972?

elements.title: nadiri (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the nadiri, a sleeveless overcoat, was personally designed by Jahangir, the fourth Mughal emperor?

elements.title: her biographical film (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that singer Barbara Mandrell thought that when she saw Maureen McCormick play her in her biographical film, "all [she was] going to be able to think about is Marcia Brady"?

elements.title: Soeparno (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Soeparno moved the official year of establishment of Surabaya, Indonesia, from 1906 to 1293?

elements.title: Balanoglossus gigas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the acorn worm Balanoglossus gigas gives a strong iodoform-like smell when handled, possibly to ward off predators?

elements.title: venbee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the musicians piri, venbee, Issey Cross, and Charlotte Plank are all part of the female and non-binary collective Loud LDN?

elements.title: New York Savings Bank Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the New York Savings Bank Building later became "The Grand Palais of Rugs" and the "Temple of Food"?

elements.title: Gaetano Bresci (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before assassinating Umberto I of Italy, Gaetano Bresci spent most of the day eating ice cream?
